list.name: Fat Tuesday

organization.name: Big City Burrito
organization.description:
Fresh. Flavorful. Fierce.
At Big City Burrito, you won’t find microwaves or freezers, and you won’t find everyday fast food, either. We pack your tortilla with everything you crave and nothing you don’t want. From carnitas to potatoes, every ingredient is perfectly seasoned with our secret recipes, and every burrito is built just for you. Why? Because it’s our mission to turn hungry into happy.

Your burrito will be the perfect blend of flavors and textures, because you choose every part of it, from the type of tortilla to each fresh, made-from-scratch filling. So you always get everything you crave and nothing you don’t want.

Big City Burrito. What you want, when you want it.

Our Mission
You walk in hungry. You walk out happy. Mission accomplished.

7:00 AM to 9:00 PM Mon - Fri 
8:00 AM to 8:00 PM Sat - Sun
Breakfast served until Noon

list.description:
Come in every Tuesday for FAT TUESDAY!

For around $5 we have a tasty potato burrito and a drink!

Hot sauces galore, great people, and a quick line!

See you soon :)

list.name: OZ Mania

organization.name: Boulder Kind Care
organization.description:
Boulder Kind Care is a medical marijuana center providing high quality medical cannabis and wellness services to Colorado Medical Marijuana cardholders. The medical marijuana we provide is locally grown and of the highest quality.

At Boulder Kind Care, we’re committed to making relationships for life with each and every one of our patients. When it comes to your health, you have alternative options to choose from that are safe, effective, reliable and confidential.

We strive to listen to our patients and accommodate your individual needs. We can recommend the best alternative options available to help you manage pain, increase appetite, relieve headaches, increase energy, manage chronic illness, assist with sleep and much more. 

We are strong supporters of our community as well as groups like NORML, Americans for Safe Access and Sensible Colorado.

Events are held frequently to promote other local business partners and we encourage our neighbors to come in and check us out! 

Members receive:
$12 - gram
4 gram - 1/8ths
8 gram - 1/4ths
28 gram oz with FREE 1/2 gram of Hash!

All MEMBERS also get a FREE 1/8th once a month with purchase of an 1/8 or 1/4.

EARLY BIRD WEEKDAZE SPECIAL
Get 10% OFF Mon-Fri between 10am-11am! Have a good morning!

Always: VETS, SENIORS and Service Industry get 10% OFF

REFER A FRIEND BONUS
Bring a new patient in with you and you both get a FREE joint!

Hours of Operation: 
Monday-Saturday 10am-7pm | Sunday 12-7pm

list.name: 15% off Concentrates

organization.name: Nature's Medicine
organization.description:
Hours of operation: 
Monday-Saturday 11am-7pm
Sunday 12 pm-5pm

We use ALL NATURAL predator controls in our growing process like lady bugs and predator mites to ensure safe, healthy medication. Need clones? We will help you find any strain you want and offer growing assistance alongside quantity discounts! We are dedicated to you to insure SAFE, RELIABLE, & AFFORDABLE Alternative resource access as well as LEGAL access to quality medication. We at Natures Medicine are very passionate about the cause for Medical Marijuana & Alternative Medications and strive to improve the quality of life for Colorado as well as our country. We will help you every step of the way to your road to a better life and provide affordable and highly effective options you've never even imagined. Check us out or write a review on WEEDMAPS.COM!

**Located next to the Boulder Dinner Theatre!!**

*MEMBERSHIP BENEFITS*

-FREE eighth every month starting the 2nd month
-10% off every purchase
-FREE joint, grind-tainer, and gram at sign-up

**TWO LOCATIONS**

5565 Arapahoe Ave., Suite G 
Boulder, CO 80303
303-440-6700

1260 S Hover St., Suite C
Longmont, CO 80501
303-772-7188

list.name: Free Meadery Tour

organization.name: Redstone Meadery
organization.description:
David Myers, known as 'Chairman of the Mead', founder of Redstone Meadery, is a romantic and wants to see mead once again enjoying the glory days of yesteryear. He started the Boulder, Colorado company with the 'natural philosophy' that he produce the highest quality honey wine on the market.
Because of this 'philosophy of mead', Redstone does not cork (to avoid oxidation) but instead uses swing top bottles. This ensures the mead will not breathe while cellaring plus offers a much longer shelf life once the bottle has been opened.
In keeping with the 'natural' approach, Redstone does not add any sulfites, a known allergen, as honey is it's own natural preservative. Redstone only pasteurizes the must (unfermented mead) and never boils. The company strives to feature the flavors of the fermentable as much as possible.
In 2003 Redstone Meadery brought the International Mead Festival (www.meadfest.com) to Boulder, Colorado and with that helped to establish mead as its own beverage category. Also at this time Redstone spearheaded the creation of the International Mead Association (www.meadfest.org) to help promote and educate the masses about the world's first fermented beverage.
Currently, Redstone products are distributed to 20 states across the U.S., making it the widest distributed wine from the state of Colorado and one of the most widely distributed meads in the country! From the Northwest to the Southeast, Ask for Mead!
Visit Us!

Free 1/2-Hour Tours: 
Mon-Fri at 1 & 3 PM,
Sat at 12:30 PM

Tasting Room open 
Mon-Fri: noon-6:30 PM,
Sat: noon-5 PM

list.description:
Tours are Free, guided and generally take 1/2 hour.

They include a free tasting for those 21 years and older. 

No reservations required for groups smaller than 10 people. Arrive a few minutes before the tour time. 

Groups of 10 or more people, please contact us at (720) 406-1215

list.name: Happy Hour At Foolish Craig's

organization.name: Foolish Craig's
organization.description:
This fun, cozy, owner operated café is open for breakfast, lunch, dinner, dessert, and drinks.

Known for its crepes, Foolish Craig’s also offers a variety of omelets, sandwiches on freshly baked breads, burgers, salads, homemade soups, and combinations at reasonable prices for breakfast and lunch served through 5pm.

The dinner menu (served after 5pm) features a variety of fresh seafood, steak, chicken, pasta, crepes, burgers and sandwiches.

list.description:
Every Monday-Friday from 3-6pm and every Sunday from 5pm-close, Foolish Craig's is dishing up some of their favorites at happy hour prices! 

Food: 
    Fries, onion rings or mix $2
    Homemade hummus and tortilla chips $3
    Chicken tenders (2) with choice of dressing $3
    Fried brussels sprouts leaves, sweet soy reduction $4
    Fried calamari, peach salsa $5
    Steamed mussels, white wine, garlic, butter $4
    Moules frites (mussels with fries) $5
    French dip sliders (2) $4
    Spinach artichoke dip, house baguette $4
    Warm brie, pear apple marmalade, house baguette $4
    Fried crab cakes, chipotle tartar $4
    Half Caesar salad $4

Drinks: 
    Bud and Bud Lite bottles $2
    Draft beer – O’Dell’s 90 Shilling, Hoss Rye Lager, Dale’s Pale Ale, Ellie’s Brown Ale $3 
    Well cocktails $3
    Import and micro bottles $3
    House wines $3.50

list.name: Tap Room Tastings

organization.name: Asher Brewing Company
organization.description:
At Asher Brewing Company our mission is operate a successful brewery that produces world-class certified organic ales, while utilizing environmentally sustainable and socially responsible business practices. Our brewery is run on 100% wind power!

    Owners, Chris Asher and Steve Turner, decided that the Boulder market deserved to have locally brewed organic beers. After nearly a year of planning, research, and hard work building a brewery, Asher Brewing Company opened the doors for business on November 20th, 2009.  

   On February 25th, 2010 organic certification was issued for all beers at Asher Brewing Company; making it the first all organic brewery in the state of Colorado. Organic ingredients are better for the consumer, better for the environment, and better for the beer. (Studies have shown that pesticides are detrimental to the shelf-life of beer.)

Chris Asher
    A native of Massachusetts, Chris has been brewing beer since his days at Wesleyan University, where he taught home-brewing classes. After college he brewed for four years at the Golden City brewery in Golden, Colorado before getting a Master’s in Business Administration from the Leeds School of Business at CU Boulder. Then he ran the brewery at the RedFish in Boulder, Colorado for five years before starting Asher Brewing Company. Brewing awards include two GABF silver medals and a gold medal in 2004 for Fat Tuesday Strong Ale.

Steven Curtis Turner
    Graduate of Colorado State University and the American Brewers Guild, Diploma in the Craft Brewers Apprenticeship Program. Holds the General Certificate in Brewing and Packaging from The Institute and Guild of Brewing. Member of the Master Brewers Association of America, Rocky Mountain Chapter. Brewing Awards 2002 World Beer Cup Gold Award, 2005 GABF Silver Medal, 2006 World Beer Cup Bronze Award, 2008 GABF Silver Medal. Steve began his professional brewing career in 1999. He lives with his wife, three kids, five cats and Bandit the Border Collie in Fort Collins.

list.name: Chophouse Happy Hour

organization.name: Boulder Chophouse & Tavern
organization.description:
Located in the heart and soul of downtown, and one block south of the historic Pearl Street Mall, the Boulder ChopHouse & Tavern sits at the base of Boulder’s scenic flatiron foothills.

Featuring a menu that blends the classics of a steak house with inspiring items developed from our local farmer’s markets, the Boulder ChopHouse couples timeless style with the city’s cutting edge culinary scene.

Open Daily at 4pm

/location/united/states /location/united/states/colorado /location/united/states/colorado/boulder /location/united/states/colorado/boulder/boulder /category/food/dining Boulder Chophouse & Tavern Located in the heart and soul of downtown, and one block south of the historic Pearl Street Mall, the Boulder ChopHouse & Tavern sits at the base of Boulder’s scenic flatiron foothills.

Featuring a menu that blends the classics of a steak house with inspiring items developed from our local farmer’s markets, the Boulder ChopHouse couples timeless style with the city’s cutting edge culinary scene.

Open Daily at 4pm Boulder Chophouse & Tavern Located in the heart and soul of downtown, and one block south of the historic Pearl Street Mall, the Boulder ChopHouse & Tavern sits at the base of Boulder’s scenic flatiron foothills.

Featuring a menu that blends the classics of a steak house with inspiring items developed from our local farmer’s markets, the Boulder ChopHouse couples timeless style with the city’s cutting edge culinary scene.

list.description:
Join us weekdays from 4pm to 6pm in our Bar and on the Patio for half price wines by the glass and tavern menu food.

Small Plates

Grilled Shrimp Cocktail. Chilled with tomato horseradish vinaigrette.  2.95 each
Onion Rings. Hand-dipped, perfectly seasoned. 4.95
Chips and Dip. Warm kettle chips served with olive tapenade. 4.95
Edamame. Mediterranean grey salt and extra virgin olive oil. 3.95
Tenderloin Slider. Warm shallot jam and pickled peppers. 4.95
Buffalo Shrimp. Crispy jumbo shrimp, tossed in buffalo sauce with buttermilk bleu cheese. 2.95 each
Rhode Island Calamari. Cornmeal crusted with cilantro chimichurri and sherry red-pepper coulis. 5.95

Salads - Soup - Sides

Add grilled salmon or chilled chicken to any salad. Salmon 4.00 Chicken 3.00

Hawaiian Tuna Poke Salad. Yellowfin tuna, grape tomatoes, fresh ginger with sweet soy vinaigrette. 14.95
Chicken Caesar. Grilled Romaine with roasted chicken, pecorino Romano and house-baked focaccia croutons. 11.95
Caprese Salad Fresh Mozzarella, grape tomatoes and grilled sweet onions tossed with arugula and basil pesto vinaigrette. 9.95
Porcini Grilled Steak Salad. Arugula, roasted red peppers, charred onions, heirloom tomatoes, bleu cheese vinaigrette. 15.95

French Onion Soup. Classically prepared. 5.95

Tavern Sides 2.95 each

Grilled Asparagus Gremolata
Sautéed Spinach
Truffled Frites
Roasted Broccoli

Tavern Classics

Steak & Frites. Sliced aged Sirloin with steak butter and truffled hand-cut frites. 15.95
Braised Short Rib Slow-roasted boneless short rib served with White Cheddar mashed potatoes. 16.95
Sundried Tomato Grilled Salmon. With asparagus-crimini risotto and truffled cauliflower sauce. 23.95
Pan Seared Roast Chicken. Fresh, boneless free-range chicken with asparagus and natural pan jus. 15.95
Slow-Roasted Prime Rib. 10-ounce cut with rosemary jus and horseradish sauce with White Cheddar mashed potatoes. 17.95

Visit http://boulderchophouse.com/2008winelist111.pdf to see our extensive wine list

list.name: Avery Brewery Tour

organization.address: 5763 Arapahoe Ave. Unit E Boulder, CO 80303
organization.name: Avery Brewing Company
organization.description:
Since 1993 our brewery has been committed to producing eccentric ales and lagers that defy styles or categories. Our products are thoroughly American at heart: blending Old World tradition and expertise with ingenuity, creativity and boldness. 

We are dedicated to making beer from the inside out: we brew what we like to drink--with utter disregard for what the market demands-- and search out fans with equally eccentric palates (We learned long ago that expressing your true self is much more fulfilling than giving in to outside pressures. Don't you agree?) If you think your taste buds can keep up with our brews, we invite you to check out our entire lineup of more than twenty different beers. 

Peace to all and follow your dreams!

The Avery Brewing Crew  
Avery Tap Room Hours:
Open 7 days a week from 12PM to 10PM! See the Tap Room page for directions and more information.

location.address: 5763 Arapahoe Ave. Unit E Boulder, CO 80303

list.description:
"Because talking about beer is almost as good as drinking beer."

Free tours are offered from the Avery Tap Room at 4PM on weekdays and at 2PM on weekends.

No reservation is required, just show up at the tap room a few minutes in advance! Typically tours last from 30-45 minutes.

Keep in mind that a large portion of the brewery tour is outside. Please dress accordingly.
